intro: Tradescantia soconuscana, commonly known as the red-veined wandering jade, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family and is characterized by its striking, variegated leaves with red veins. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It is a compact, evergreen perennial that thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in gardens.
